issue.title: does pm2 can launch a c++ program?

repository.name: pm2
repository.description: Node.js Production Process Manager with a built-in Load Balancer.

issue.body:
i have a program write by c/c++, and i want to make it daemon with pm2, 

but, when i use 

```
pm2 start ./bin/p -x 
```

to start it, it notice me an error

and when i use a bash script to start it, it can't to restart.....

i got an error:

```
Error retrieving process list: Error: ENOENT, open '/proc/16676/stat'.
A process seems to be on infinite loop, retry in 5 seconds
```

so, please help me.

body:
Hi guys:

I've been having troubles getting these binaries to go via cmd line &/or via json declaration.  Could you provide some tips?  As example, I am trying to run a zedrem server via `pm2 start /usr/bin/zedrem -- --server` and it renders the following in the error log:

```
(function (exports, require, module, __filename, __dirname) { ELF
                                                          ^
SyntaxError: Unexpected token ILLEGAL
at Module._compile (module.js:439:25)
at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:474:10)
at Module.load (module.js:356:32)
at Function.Module._load (module.js:312:12)
at Function.Module.runMain (module.js:497:10)
at startup (node.js:119:16)
at node.js:906:3
```

`/usr/bin/zedrem -- --server` works great.

pm2:  0.10.8
npm:  2.0.0
node: 0.10.30.

Thanks for the tip.  It does seem like the interpreter is the issue, as it now fails with this with your updated command.  Note the new characters between old and new:

```
/usr/bin/zedrem:1
(function (exports, require, module, __filename, __dirname) { ^?ELF^B^A^A
                                                              ^
SyntaxError: Unexpected token ILLEGAL
    at Module._compile (module.js:439:25)
    at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:474:10)
    at Module.load (module.js:356:32)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:312:12)
     at Function.Module.runMain (module.js:497:10)
     at startup (node.js:119:16)
     at node.js:906:3

at Module.load (module.js:356:32)
at Function.Module._load (module.js:312:12)
 at Function.Module.runMain (module.js:497:10)
 at startup (node.js:119:16)
 at node.js:906:3
```
Actually, i missed the -x.  Apologies, will test again shortly
Yep, that did it!  Much appreciated!

issue.title: executing arbitrary command instead of script file

repository.name: pm2
repository.description: Node.js Production Process Manager with a built-in Load Balancer.

issue.body:
I have tried to play with it a little but with no luck

```
{
  "name": "rtail-server",
  "script": "rtail-server --web-port 9999 --udp-port 9090 --udp-host 0.0.0.0",
  "exec_interpreter": "bash",
  "exec_mode": "fork_mode"
}
```

I am using a `.json` file to declare the job and I always get 

```
[PM2][ERROR] script not found : ...
```

body:
> pm2 start /usr/bin/zedrem --interpreter none -x -- --server

What about passing some params to the server ?

What I've is an inhouse-self-compiled C app, I actually run it with : 
`usr/local/bin/myApp -d param.json `

What I tried is : 
```
pm2 start "usr/local/bin/myApp -d param.json"  --interpreter none -x -- --server

pm2 start usr/local/bin/myApp -d param.json  --interpreter none -x -- --server
```

Nothing seems to work..
Any help will be appreciated

Thanks @vmarchaud! 

I've tried this : 

`pm2 start  "myApp -d param.json" --interpreterArgs  --interpreter none -x -- --server`

 And I got an error  :

> error: unknown option `--interpreterArgs'

Then I've seen the [doc ](http://pm2.keymetrics.io/docs/usage/pm2-api/) but can't see any sample using this option in action.
You don't have the choice so, use a process file like documented [right there](http://pm2.keymetrics.io/docs/usage/application-declaration/#general)

I'm having a similar issue when launching my app in cluster mode. If I run
 `pm2 start app`  everything works correctly but if I run `pm2 start ecosystem.config.json` I got this error: 

```bash
 ~/app:1
 (function (exports, require, module, __filename, __dirname) { ELF
                                                               ^
 
 SyntaxError: Invalid or unexpected token
     at createScript (vm.js:80:10)
     at Object.runInThisContext (vm.js:139:10)
     at Module._compile (module.js:616:28)
     at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:663:10)
     at Module.load (module.js:565:32)
     at tryModuleLoad (module.js:505:12)
     at Function.Module._load (module.js:497:3)
     at /usr/local/lib/node_modules/pm2/lib/ProcessContainer.js:323:23
     at /usr/local/lib/node_modules/pm2/node_modules/async/dist/async.js:473:16
     at next (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/pm2/node_modules/async/dist/async.js:5329:29)
```

ecosystem.config.js: 

```javascript
module.exports = {
  apps : [
      {
        script: "app",
        exec_interpreter : "none",
        instances : "max",
        exec_mode : "cluster"
      }
  ]
}
```

I think it is a problem related with the interpreter but I don't understand why it doesn't work just in cluster mode and it works in single instance mode. 
The app is a nodejs application packaged using [pkg](https://github.com/zeit/pkg). I output there other information about `app` file: 

```bash
app: ELF 64-bit LSB executable, x86-64, version 1 (GNU/Linux), dynamically linked, interpreter /lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2, for GNU/Linux 2.6.18, BuildID[sha1]=0f362bc7852d2f8ab7e1b7c95ad989883021996f, with debug_info, not stripped
```

I have the same issue ! when I dont specify `"exec_interpreter": "none",` app start in fork - mode, but with `"exec_interpreter": "none",` included in .json file app start in cluster - mode but I get the following error:
```
SyntaxError: Invalid or unexpected token
04:58:23 5|app  |     at new Script (vm.js:79:7)
04:58:23 5|app  |     at createScript (vm.js:251:10)
04:58:23 5|app  |     at Object.runInThisContext (vm.js:303:10)
04:58:23 5|app  |     at Module._compile (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:657:28)
04:58:23 5|app  |     at Object.Module._extensions..js (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:700:10)
04:58:23 5|app  |     at Module.load (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:599:32)
04:58:23 5|app  |     at tryModuleLoad (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:538:12)
04:58:23 5|app  |     at Function.Module._load (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:530:3)
04:58:23 5|app  |     at Function._load (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/pm2/node_modules/@pm2/io/build/main/metrics/httpMetrics.js:172:43)
04:58:23 5|app  |     at /usr/local/lib/node_modules/pm2/lib/ProcessContainer.js:295:23
04:58:23 6|app  | /bin/bash:1
04:58:23 6|app  | (function (exports, require, module, __filename, __dirname) { ELF
04:58:23 6|app  |                                                               ^
04:58:23 6|app  | SyntaxError: Invalid or unexpected token
04:58:23 6|app  |     at new Script (vm.js:79:7)
04:58:23 6|app  |     at createScript (vm.js:251:10)
04:58:23 6|app  |     at Object.runInThisContext (vm.js:303:10)
04:58:23 6|app  |     at Module._compile (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:657:28)
04:58:23 6|app  |     at Object.Module._extensions..js (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:700:10)
04:58:23 6|app  |     at Module.load (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:599:32)
04:58:23 6|app  |     at tryModuleLoad (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:538:12)
04:58:23 6|app  |     at Function.Module._load (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:530:3)
04:58:23 6|app  |     at Function._load (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/pm2/node_modules/@pm2/io/build/main/metrics/httpMetrics.js:172:43)
04:58:23 6|app  |     at /usr/local/lib/node_modules/pm2/lib/ProcessContainer.js:295:23
```
